climbs.name: Regular Route
climbs.fa: First ascent, 1950: first pitch led by Dick Pownall, second by Bob Merriam. Mike Brewer and Leigh Ortenburger also participated. Some pro on both pitc

content.protection: Stoppers and smallish cams or tcu's for the second pitch. The initial wide crack has no pro unless you carry a big cam or hex, in the #5 or greater range (for a cam.)
content.location: The wide crack on the southeast side of the tower is unmistakable. Climb it, traverse right to the north side, and continue up the left edge of the north face.

climbs.name: Red Alert
climbs.fa: Greg Collins, Sue Miller, Hans Johnstone

content.description:
South Face of Red Sentinel; Red colored rock at toe of south side.

Face climbing on excellent rock of slightly increasing difficulty, 5.7 to 5.10a to break. Crux above, then exposed face to top 70 m.
content.protection:
1 set cams, med stoppers, double sling for horn at 3/4 height

many quick draws.
content.location: Rappel from summit anchor station 60 m
